messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: A few whines/wines about the conference
messages.msgSnippet: We ll have to remember to check the bathroom occasionally. LOL! I get nervious and laugh a lot. ;-) Barb E It is change, continuing change, inevitable change,
messages.messageBody:
We'll have to remember to check the bathroom occasionally. LOL! I get
nervious and laugh a lot. ;-)


Barb E
"It is change, continuing change, inevitable change, that
is the dominant factor in society today. No sensible
decision can be made any longer without taking into
account not only the world as it is, but the world as it
will be."

- Isaac Asimov, Science Fiction Writer




on 8/13/03 12:00 AM, KathrynJB@... at KathrynJB@... wrote:
So someone
>> take pity on me and pull me into the group if I'm standing there like a deer
>> in headlights, ok? ~Rue (lover of cheap champagne)
>>
>>
> Rue, I can be a little shy too. I'll be your friend :)
>
> Kathryn

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Re: A few whines/wines about the conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... Kathryn **Thank you, Kathryn!  I already feel better now :0). I was going to email you - if you have any interest in a reptile show at the conference next
messages.messageBody:
>>I'll be your friend :)

Kathryn

**Thank you, Kathryn! I already feel better now :0).

I was going to email you - if you have any interest in a reptile show at the
conference next year, I saw a wonderful one the other day. The presenters
were so respectful towards the children it was amazing. It was very hands
on, and a lot of fun. They're a non-profit group and told me they'll travel
anywhere in MA for a homeschooling group. Let me know if you want their
contact info. ~Rue

messages.subject: Re: A few whines/wines about the conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/12/2003 10:33:20 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Rue, I can be a little shy too. I ll be your friend :) Kathryn [Non-text portions of this
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/12/2003 10:33:20 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Hearing about everyone sitting around drinking wine last year made me so
> jealous. I definitely want some hanging out time with you guys, and my big
> fear about the conference is that I'm going to revert back to high school
> shy when I see you all together, some of you already friends. So someone
> take pity on me and pull me into the group if I'm standing there like a deer
> in headlights, ok? ~Rue (lover of cheap champagne)
>
>
Rue, I can be a little shy too. I'll be your friend :)

Kathryn
